pageContext.description: Central part of blade, probably class V; edge of one wing rough and chipped, the other has a chip out of each end; wider end of socket slightly crushed; remains of haft in socket. Each wing is decorated with a pattern of two concentric circles enclosing a central dot, the pattern being repeated on the other side.
pageContext.patina: Thin green patina, with golden-bronze showing through.
pageContext.associations: Part of a large hoard: see card for first spearhead V.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX, 279,Evans,Jessup, Arch of Kent, 107,Journ. Anthrop. Inst. III, 230
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hagut Wood, on limit of railway cutting, 6 ft. below surface, lying on a stratum of sand, c. 25 yards NE by N of summit of hill.,Found June 4, 1872.
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
